title: NIGHTSHADE
author: Michael Connelly
description: The Los Angeles County sheriff's detective Stilwell gets reassigned to Catalina Island, where he investigates a poaching case and a Jane Doe found in the harbor.

title: THE KNIGHT AND THE MOTH
author: Rachel Gillig
description: Sybil Delling, who is gifted with the power of foresight, forms an alliance with a heretical knight when her sister Diviners disappear.

title: IRON FLAME
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training under the new vice commandant might require her to betray the man she loves.

title: THE TENANT
author: Freida McFadden
description: Things take an unsettling turn when a marketing executive loses his job and a woman rents a room in his brownstone.

title: REWIND IT BACK
author: Liz Tomforde
description: The fifth book in the Windy City series. Hallie Hart gets assigned to a renovation project for a hockey player who was her first crush.

title: ORIGINAL SIN
author: Jake Tapper and Alex Thompson
description: An account of Joe Biden’s initial decision to run for re-election in 2024 and its numerous consequences.

title: UNCOMMON FAVOR
author: Dawn Staley
description: The three-time Olympic gold medalist and six-time W.N.B.A. All-Star, who is the head coach for the South Carolina Gamecocks women’s basketball team, describes obstacles she encountered on and off the court.

title: MARK TWAIN
author: Ron Chernow
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer portrays the life and career of the literary celebrity and political pundit.

title: APPLE IN CHINA
author: Patrick McGee
description: A journalist depicts the development of Apple’s supply chain and its increasingly precarious relationship with China.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: WE CAN DO HARD THINGS
author: Glennon Doyle, AbWambach and Amanda Doyle

title: DON'T BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU THINK, EXPANDED EDITION
author: Joseph Nguyen

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: MALCOLM LIVES!
author: Ibram X. Kendi
description: A biography of the human rights activist Malcolm X. (Ages 10 to 14)

title: RIVER OF SPIRITS
author: Shana Targosz
description: Senka and Poppy get lost together in the Underworld. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: BECAUSE I HAD A TEACHER
author: Kobi Yamada. Illustrated Natalie Russell
description: An ode to teachers. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: WILL THE PIGEON GRADUATE?
author: Mo Willems
description: The Pigeon questions his academic future. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: WHY A DAUGHTER NEEDS A DAD
author: Gregory E. Lang. Illustrated Sydney Hanson
description: A father's love for his daughter. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: PAPA'S COMING HOME
author: Chasten Buttigieg. Illustrated Dan Taylor
description: The twins prepare for Papa’s return home. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: I LOVE DAD WITH THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: Eric Carle
description: Celebrating dad with help from that insatiable insect. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: WATCH ME
author: Tahereh Mafi
description: After 10 years, the Reestablishment looks to make a move on the New Republic of the West. (Ages 14 and up)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)

title: HEARTLESS HUNTER
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: REBEL WITCH
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune and Gideon must join forces to stop a sinister plot by Cressida Roseblood. (Ages 13 to 18)
